website_summaries.verdict: It's not as flashy as some of its competitors, but this Sony universal remote offers a user-friendly layout and an affordable price tag.
pros: Offers many single-touch system control functions, which effectively control a wide variety of TVs, DVD players, and similar appliances
cons: Some of the remote's buttons are awkwardly placed, making it easy for users to accidentally hit other buttons

customer_reviews.title: Learning Does not work with Rechargables
customer_reviews.text: Hard to give this higher than 3 stars as the directions are fairly poor and and worse still that the learning functions do not work with rechargeable batteries. NEVER mentioned anywhere in the instructions!! For 2019, this is pretty terrible. - Instructions missing basic info to get device to work properly or diagnose it. - Instructions are terse and you will need to read each section multiple times fully utilize the device. - Does not have codes for soundbars .. again it's 2019!? - Does not support fireTV or other non IR remotes. This should be part of the shop listing since these are such common devices.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Worthless/Time Wasted
customer_reviews.text: The problem for this Universal Remote is the same for all of them. The TV electronic world is so complex that it is impossible to run your empire with one remote. If it could be done, you would need a huge remote with a hundred buttons on it to perform all your features. I have a Sony DVD, Sony TV and Sony Sound Track and this Sony Universal Remote will not begin to perform all the functions on just these three devices. Then I have DISH network, Amazon, Roku and more and this remote won't come close to efficiently running any of them. Great idea but a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Chicester

customer_reviews.title: A Big Surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting this to be as good as it is, I bought a new Sony TV 4k UltraHD and the remote that came with it doesn't work at all with our HD set-top box, (Time Warner or now, Spectrum). This universal remote came with the codes for the TV and the set-top box already in it!! I have many other devices but don't care about that at all, I just wanted something that would let me, (and hopefully my almost blind wife), use the new TV with the existing set-top box without juggling two remotes....This Sony RMVLZ620 Universal Remote is it! Would give this 10 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with ROKU
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with ROKU! Followed "learning" instructions perfectly, but in the end the it did not function at all with ROKU. I gave it 2 stars, since it seemed to function properly for my SEIKI TV (which isn't well known and not on the list of codes) after it went through the "search" feature. Same for my very old Sony stereo system, which I use as the audio system...mind you, the preset Sony code for audio did not work. I had to go through the search feature for it as well. Bottom line, I have to have a remote that works with ROKU, since I cut the cable cord and 100% streaming tv these days. I'm returning this remote tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: David D Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: Does the job of multiple remotes
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old Sony universal remote because the buttons were wearing out. This is the closest current model I could find that had nearly identical features to the old one. I was able to program the new remote almost exactly like the old one was set up. In some areas, the instruction manual is unclear and, in some cases, actually incorrect. But, with some fiddling I discovered the correct ways to program the remote. Now I have a new remote with working buttons that takes the place of several remotes.
customer_reviews.author: T. L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy well build remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote is sturdier than the one that came with my Sceptre TV (Walmart). I didn't do any extra programming besides finding the code to work with my TV, so.this remote does not have quite all the functions of the original remote: channel guide, Roku, etc., but it has the basics that I use most: power, channel, volume, scroll, enter, source. I use this one most of the time to extend the life of the flimsy original remote. We added a second one of these remotes to control the TV from the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: SWS

customer_reviews.title: Only Sony remote you need
customer_reviews.text: If you have Sony stuff, look no further. This thing is amazing because of its learning capability. I used to have the 320 model but it couldn’t learn. This is only 10 Bucks more. It worked out if the box with my Blu-ray, my amp, my vcr. My TV is LG, had no trouble programming that. Then I programmed my Roku remote using the learning function. Very good instructions by the way. And an actual printed remote code list. Overall a great purchase, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: fenstersponge

customer_reviews.title: Sony RMVLZ620
customer_reviews.text: I've had this remote for my family room for more than a year and decided to buy another for my bedroom. I love that you can customize this remote almost any way you want. If you have the existing remote you can use it to program it. You can program TV functions with the cable functions, so you don't have to switch between functions. It works very well with my Directv system and I even can control my stereo receiver with it.
customer_reviews.author: 53JK

customer_reviews.title: This is an AWESOME remote!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the age of the tech in this device deceive you, it is ABSOLUTELY the most AWESOME learning remote I have ever owned! It doesn't have any streaming device codes but it was super easy to program my Roku commands into the device.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Nice remote, but even other SONY devices may need manual programming
customer_reviews.text: Great remote, once correct code was entered. My problem was in using it for a SONY Blue Ray DVD/Home Theater. I downloaded the Remote's Owner's Manual prior to purchasing, where it states the remote will work with any SONY product without programming. However, it did not work at all with my SONY product. I had to use the instruction for Non SONY products (though they include SONY on the list of codes) and it was the third code I tried under SONY DVD/Home Theater. I would give four stars, if the Instruction/Owner's Manual would have stated "Some SONY products may need manual programming". I would give five stars, if it worked out of the box for my SONY device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive remote for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe all the features this remote has for the low price. With macros, remote to remote learning and so many ways to program and change buttons I would expect to pay lots more. I do wish the buttons could light up but for this price no complaints. My favorite feature is the angle I can use this remote at and still make everything work. I can sit places I never could before and it will reach all my devices. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Works really good. Some of the configurations are complicated to figure ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really good. Some of the configurations are complicated to figure out. But getting it to recognize my TV and AMP were pretty easy. A complaint I have, is that it you have to hit Input to switch inputs one at a time. I would like to hit TV and it switch to TV. Or hit Bluray and it switch to the blu-ray player. Also, there is no master Stereo volume. So if I hit volume and it is on the Bluray player, it will try to change the volume on the Bluray player, not the stereo receiver. I have to switch to AMP to lower the volume if something gets loud.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Works great and the learning mode allows this remote to mimic ANY (and I mean any) infrared remote.
customer_reviews.text: The heavily used buttons (like volume) do wear out over time (a year or so). My last Amazon order was from Krishna Stores (12/2018) and advertised as new, but came with this aluminium sealed package with a label stating "Tested OK" (kind of suspicious). We will see. If you are replacing an old RMVLZ620, you should still have the code documentation. If not, you will have to go online to get the codes (again, not in the new packaging with the codes included). Not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be ok.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my older Sony AV Receiver was not plugged in out of the box. I had to program it into the remote. Seems to control my older Sony equipment decently. The Input button does not toggle through the inputs as I hoped, but it controls the volume and changes CD songs/discs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: alexD

customer_reviews.title: Best remote for many devices, especially Sony units
customer_reviews.text: This is a 2010 model. I have used one for years, but it became erratic, and cleaning the circuit board and the keys failed to revive it. The new one is exactly the same, and because it has a keyboard, completely programmable (each button can be separately taught--specific to each of 8 devices [TV, Cable, Amp, etc]. I have used much more expensive controls with smartphone-like screen controls. This one has real buttons, as will the next generation of cellphones. It is particularly useful if you have Sony products because of proprietary shortcuts. My Comcast controller has dust on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jawx

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote. Not especially difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: Excellent remote. Not especially difficult to program, more of a pain in the posterior. After the one time setup, it's an excellent remote. Works well with devices made after the remote (ie Roku), but like I said a bit of nuisance. I would love it if Sony made a revision with more supported devices.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding remote.
customer_reviews.text: This learning remote control has a lot of features on it which worked out very well for all my upgraded electronic surround sound system. It was exactly as described and works flawlessly. Once you learn how to program the remote or even used the learning feature then this remote performs very well and feels very comfortable in the hand. I would definitely recommend buying this remote. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Not your average universal remote.
customer_reviews.text: I've used quite a few lackluster universal remotes over the years, but this one is worth the money (and is quite affordable, at that). What sets this remote apart is its ability to learn what your other remotes do. Without going into full detail, you essentially point your other remote and the RMVLZ620 toward one another, and it learns what that remote does. This is great for controlling all sorts of audio/visual devices with one remote. Additionally, I love its size. At 9.3 inches long, it's hard to misplace.
customer_reviews.author: Everett

customer_reviews.title: I love this remote
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote. This is hands down the best remote I've ever had. I have it programmed for so much stuff. It took a lot of reading in the manual but I was able to get it to work for everything that takes IR. And the sequence programming is great. I now have one button that will turn everything on and change the channel and inputs with just a push. It's so useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Brown

customer_reviews.title: Simple design and use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple design, looks like an ordinary remote, with the same basic programming as the expensive models. Was pretty easy to setup if you have programmed a universal remote before, works with all of my devices and I enjoy the macro function, which gives you the ability to turn on and off all devices with the push of one button. I gave it 5 stars, because of the simplicity of the design and use and what a cost savings in comparision to the more expensive models
customer_reviews.author: Tom Reynoldson

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and I don't have to point it as ...
customer_reviews.text: Since I have an SMSL Q5 for audio, and 99% of "Universal" remotes have absolutely zero way of working with it, I got this for its learning functions. Works great, and I don't have to point it as precisely as the remote that came with the amp. My phone also has a learning function for its built in remote, but that requires me to hold the phone directly in front of the sensor. Really, short buying one of those schmancy Logitech Harmony remotes, this is by far the best thing you can get for anything that uses IR.
customer_reviews.author: A. Evertson

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement remote!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have anywhere near the number of buttons and toggles as the remote it replaces; but as long as you have the time to figure out which buttons operate the major functions of the replaced remote, you're fine. It's better than a challenged original Sony remote with a small light that would never go out, resulting in it burning through a pair of alkaline batteries every couple of weeks. I've had the new one for a couple months now, with its first set of batteries still running. And I expect them to last at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: marcusmembrane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and Great Functionality (updated)
customer_reviews.text: Programming is easy. Programmed the cable box (Pace), TV (Samsung), receiver (Philips), blu-ray (Samsung), old Liteon DVR, and a Roku. After initial programming I fine tuned certain remote functions by programming individual buttons using the learn function. This remote makes Logitech Harmony obsolete. Excellent value and great functionality. Update - I liked this product so I bought 4 more but 2 out of them were lemons and couldn't be programmed. Taking off a star for high percentage of lemons. If you get a working product, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with learning functions
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting better from Sony. I have not been able to get the learning functions to work with any remotes I have tried. I also can't figure out how to control the volume on my receiver without switching to that function on the remote. I have read the manual multiple times with no success. Other than that it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Sony did good, simple very functional.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks and not just for the price and functionality, the button layout is pretty spot on, if your having problems with the learning function there's a review that covers that, mainly in the second to last step you have to hold the new 'learning' button on the sony for a couple seconds, not just a quick push and not a hold the whole time your trying to make it learn, like a good button layout much more than anything logitech throws out there and there web based software, not fun..
customer_reviews.author: crap or worth having?

customer_reviews.title: Cable Remotes Gotta Go!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if you can get a nicer universal remote for the money. This is simply the best remote you'll but under $30. It feels really nice in the hand and the buttons couldn't be positioned better. Must replace the cable remote with this one!
customer_reviews.author: gdman71

customer_reviews.title: Very nice remote
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few years now. For the price, it is great. It runs everything I have. Audio components, video, TV... also AppleTV and even iTunes on my MacBook, which I use as a music server. The pre programmed code list is extensive, but whatever that doesn't cover, it can learn from another remote. I have a whole drawer full of remotes that I never have to look at.
customer_reviews.author: DPD1

customer_reviews.title: Good product, except one change...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one a few years ago in town. It was excellent. It did many functions, operated well, helped to remove a lot of clutter by reducing my 3 remotes into one. I liked it so much I decided to buy another one a few years later. Everything about the product is the same, except this product is not as sturdy as the first one. The housing material is of a cheaper quality as well. For this reason I gave it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: ClassicLady

customer_reviews.title: First one purchased years ago worked great, newly purchased devices do not work in learning mode at all.
customer_reviews.text: I can't get it to program in learning mode. I gave up on it. Tech support had no solutions. It simply didn't work the way the manual described. I've purchased this item before and it worked fine until I finally wore out the keypad. I loved the convenience of One Remote to Rule Them All and the learning function made it truly omnipotent. But I've now tried two new devices recently and neither one works.
customer_reviews.author: Techgineer

customer_reviews.title: Replaces the Remote for a Sony XBR 4
customer_reviews.text: My old remote for my Sony XBR 4 was having trouble when you tried to push any buttons. I was able to take it apart a couple times and clean the board inside, and it would work great for about a week. I was going to replace it with the exact model of remote I had before, but I saw this one, and decided to give it a try. This remote is awesome! It does everything the old remote would do, and it’ll run everything in my entertainment center. Talk about range, if you can see the IR sensor on the TV, this remote will work. My old remote never worked like this one. For $21, you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Christlieb

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one, first lasted over 7 years.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, first lasted over 7 years. Easy to program, works for everything except my Roku. Good reliable remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: This is the finest remote control that we have owned. It worked perfectly out of the box -- with no programming (because our equipment is Sony). We are totally impressed with the functionality, ease of use, and quality construction of this remote. We are so pleased with it that we are considering ordering another. The seller delivered this item early; and it is even better than it was represented. I gladly would do business with this seller again. I highly recommend this remote, especially if you intend to control Sony equipment with it.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBum59

customer_reviews.title: This remote has very little lag between key presses for WMC and I was able to program it pretty easily for all the functions I u
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after being frustrated with the Logitech Harmony Touch remote for use with my Windows Media Center and other components. The Harmony had way too much lag time between key presses and the UI was slow and not intuitive. This remote has very little lag between key presses for WMC and I was able to program it pretty easily for all the functions I use on a regular basis. This "basic" remote handles pretty much everything I need, including macros for turning on and off several components with one button. You will need to have another WMC remote available for programming since the Sony doesn't have a built-in code for it.
customer_reviews.author: emx2500

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate , works great !
customer_reviews.text: I received this device and was able to quickly get this remote to replace a number of other remotes. There were codes available for several of my devices and they worked well. I was able to set up other devices via the learning function. I have only had this device for a few days, but so far I am very pleased with the functionality of this remote. Some devices are easier to set up than others which means that some devices will be easy to set up and some devices will require more work to function properly. I am very pleased with this remote and will update my review as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: John G. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Best.Remote.Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my many remotes. With the learning function and the many supported brands/devices, this replaced ALL of them! Now with one remote I can control my Samsung LED TV, my Samsung DVD player, my Sony AV Receiver, my LED strip lights and my Amazon Pedestal Fan!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Wellman

customer_reviews.title: Another great remote by Sony
customer_reviews.text: Nobody does universal remotes like Sony. I had some doubts after reading negative reviews, but got it anyway because my AV receiver is Sony, and I'm very glad I did. I had no problem programming my 7 devices, and most functions I need work right out of the box, especially on the Motorola DVR cable box. I was surprised to see how little I had to manually program using the learning function, which works just as well as it did on my old Sony RM-VL900. The only drawback is - the last device selected in a system control sequence is not remembered, reverting back to the pre-sequence selection, but I can live with that. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Tankhimovich

customer_reviews.title: Jack of All Trades
customer_reviews.text: The Universal remote worked with nearly all of my devices except for the HD tuner. I have 5 other devices that I have attached to 1 remote now. The downfall of this device was that it didn't recognize most of my devices so I had to program 3 of them manually, but it is nice to have that option available to me. It seems cumbersome at first but you learn the buttons fairly quickly with everyday use. I would recommend this to anyone who is trying to eliminate using multiple remotes.
customer_reviews.author: bcords

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this! I have been suffering with two remotes for one tv, because not all the features worked on either remote. This one does it all! Volume up and down, channels up and down too! Bought another one today, for another tv. Thanks Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Still searching for a true universal remote.
customer_reviews.text: I was only able to replace two of my three remotes with this one since it is not, by definition, a universal remote. For example, there are no manufacturers codes for the DirectTV gini mini set-top-boxes either wired or wireless and I have both. I also tried both the learning features and the search code features. Neither of which worked so I am disappointed and won't be buying these again. Still searching for a true universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: C. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Best Universal Remote Control.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and returned RCA, Philips, Logitech and URC remote controls and this Sony is the best. I bought two. It is many dedicated programmable buttons. Logitech you have to scroll through the screen to get to the function you wanted. Sony is easy to program. The learning remote functions are easy to program, if there is not a dedicated button you can program a button to perform that function. Just keep the manual handy or view it online at Sony.com One improvement... I wish it was backlighted.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good universal remote
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly good universal remote. I programmed my surround sound, tv, blu ray player, and air conditioners easily. Then I use the learning mode to program a custom remote that controlled everything so I don't have to switch between devices constantly. I'm not a fan of the layout, but I am slowly adjusting to it. Its the best universal remote I have ever used, and its only $20. Do yourself a favor and purchase this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Lee Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: I love this remote...BUT....
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought 2, 1 from Best Buy then 1 from Amazon in which the down button for changing channels on the TV and for the cable box did not work. The up button worked, but not the down. I had them replaced and the replacements works fine. So if you're having a difficult time trying to program (learn mode)a few buttons on the remote, it may be the remote and not you. Other than that, this remote was also able to learn all my remotes including the functions off of a AIOS media player remote from China. Really worth the $25 retail price tag vs any of Logitech Harmony's high priced remotes.
customer_reviews.author: BeggarMan

customer_reviews.title: Great Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: Received in new packaged condition. Relatively easy to program, and does exactly what it should. Very flexible programming options, and the learning aspect is perfect. Using this to control 4 devices: Sony Bravia TV DirecTV Receiver Sony A/V Receiver Apple TV Works flawlessly on all. Now only one remote! Can't speak to longevity, but would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BRS

customer_reviews.title: Learning function is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: The learning function on this remote is the reason I bought the remote. The ability to pick and choose which buttons control which device all on 1 device is great. The remote was able to find my TV no problem, and I easily programmed in the required buttons from the other remotes I wanted on this remote. The remote feels solid in the hand and the buttons are very responsive. I only wish the white keys had some kind of luminescence so they could be seen a bit easier in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: R. Borgeous

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!  Does everything!
customer_reviews.text: This remote does everything I need. I used to have Harmony remotes to control a home stereo in another room. This remote with an IR repeater is much better. And MUCH cheaper. No learning issues, no delays, no problems. Very strong IR emitters. Only thing to note: as others described here. To change device functions set the macros to the device buttons. Then to activate the macro hold the device buttons for just a second or 2. Just tapping the button only changes the remote's device control. I will never look at another remote again. I still cant believe how inexpensive it is!
customer_reviews.author: David Manoni

customer_reviews.title: Easily and accurately programmed or all devices.
customer_reviews.text: Accurately programs controls for TV, DirecTV remote, DVD player, older style stereo receiver for surround sound (limited to volume and function due to receiver age) works great
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Vanderburg

customer_reviews.title: No function left behind.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, learning universal remote. No way will I get stuck with a non=learning remote leaving me only with 1/2 the functions I really need. I now control my TV, Boombox, Stereo, Blue Ray, Fan, A/C, etc all in one remote in full. This is easy to program and use. I only wish it lit up all the buttons in the dark with color changing LED's.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Operates perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Operates all my devices even AppleTV. Easy to program. I’ve owned several bc it’s very reasonably priced and works great. Hope Sony continues to make this model.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Effing awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The first universal remote I've ever had that will control everything on my tv stand. My Samsung soundbar needed to be "learned" by the remote, and that process worked better than I expected. Same with my Toshiba blue ray player. There are a couple of buttons that aren't immediately obvious in functioning (live function for my Knology dvr is the "D" button) but 99% of my functions are straightforward and a direct transfer. This was a well thought out remote, and very welcome at the price point. I might have to order a couple more to stash away for other rooms or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dally Whacker

customer_reviews.title: Very nice universal remote, learning feature is worth the extra price
customer_reviews.text: I've previously used Sony RMVZ320 remotes and like them, but couldn't find a way to use them with my LG sound bar. The learning feature in the Sony RMVLZ620 solved this completely. It let me enter the programming code for my TV, and then individually copy my LG signals for the Volume and Mute functions. Unlike some other reviews here, I had no trouble programming these buttons. Now I can control my cable box and TV, and automatically control the sound bar for audio. It's very nice, and worth the price difference in remotes. I also like the feature on the RMVLZ620 that flashes the button of the device being controlled because it confirms what device is currently selected.
customer_reviews.author: JerrySm

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck as long as you don't need the 4 color-coded buttons.
customer_reviews.text: Nice remote. I'm new to the universal remote and I haven't done any of the amazing macro programming that I know this can do. It's just easier than using the 4 different remotes I have for my cable box, tv, amp, and bluray player. My only gripe is that it does not have the 4 color buttons that the other sony remotes have. So, when I'm using the amazon instant video app on my blu ray player, I can't just hit the blue button to bring up the search feature. I have to navigate the menus to get to it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maresca

customer_reviews.title: Yes this is gonna work for your shit if it’s Sony.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a receiver that’s probably more than 15 years old. Sony, and no it didn’t work out of the box but yes it worked immediately after I entered a couple codes, this was a longshot that this remote would work and it did After properly programming it.. Kudos, shipped fast and awesome remote.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to learn
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got a bad remote or what, but I couldn't get the learning function to work. I tried for over an hour and tried putting new batteries (two sets) in the Sony remote and in the ones I was trying to get it to learn from. My older "All for One" remote was able to learn from these so it wasn't a matter of incompatibility. The batteries were bought this summer and good until 2023. Gave it two stars because the codes worked for most remotes but I like to customize mine. If learning is important to you I would try another model or different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This remote is useless for my needs. It’s a Sony remote and doesn’t even work with my new Sony tv - even after trying all of the codes. It also doesn’t work with my Comcast box, and it barely controls my Denon receiver (it works every third time I press a button).
customer_reviews.author: irishrep

customer_reviews.title: I put it to use today and so far it works beautifully with my Sony KDL-40XBR
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my Sony branded remote today. I put it to use today and so far it works beautifully with my Sony KDL-40XBR. All I had to do was put AA batteries in it. Then I pressed the on button and it turned the tv on with zero programing. This seems to be a genuine Sony made product. The remote, the packaging, and the instruction booklet all have Sony marked on them. The instruction booklet says that the remote is already programmed to work with all Sony products.

customer_reviews.title: very good universal remote control
customer_reviews.text: Good quality remote control, highly customizable, can be programmed to do just about anything. It's a bit big in your hand because it has so many buttons for the many functions across various devices, but still recommended if you're in the market for a "one does everything" remote.
customer_reviews.author: ramirez98

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to control our home theater. I use it to control my Apple TV, Sony TV, Moxi DVR, Yamaha receiver and Panasonic Blu-Ray player. For some (Sony TV) it was pretty straighforward, for others, I needed to have it learn functions from the original remote. It replaces most functions, but not all. I still need to pull out the original Yamaha remote to do some tasks, and when entering numbers for channels, it often double enters (press "1" and "1" for 11, but get 111). After using it for about 3 months, my wife and son are still asking me how to watch a movie.
customer_reviews.author: scientist guy

customer_reviews.title: It's good, but could use some help with component switching buttons!
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but with my setup (Onkyo receiver with Sony DVD player, Phillips TV) it's not easy to switch between the components on the receiver. For example you use the number key pad at the bottom, and have to guess which number corresponds to which component (was Video 2 number 4 or was it number 6 on the keypad??? -- that kind of thing). Otherwise its nice. The sony DVD player required no setup at all, just works. I had previously had a Sony universal remote that this replaced, and that's why I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has some flaws...
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good quality remote and the learning mode is pretty easy to use, and so far it's gone a long way on one set of batteries. But it has two fairly significant flaws. First, you can't re-program any of the 'feature-type' buttons - so you're forced to re-program the NUMBER buttons to work a lot of functions (not the end of the world but a little strange). Second, and I may be nit-picking, but the back-side is rounded from end-to-end, so if you have the remote sitting on a table and you push ANY button, the stupid thing just rolls over and scoots away. Really a major design flaw IMHO!
customer_reviews.author: EveryDamnJim

customer_reviews.title: Backward-compatible with mid-2000s Toshiba DVD, even older Panasonic TV.
customer_reviews.text: It has many built-in bits for our 8-y.o. Toshiba DVD player/recorder. The "learn" function, where you shine the old, dying, remote into this one, is pretty simple to set up. If you wear out, lose, or break remotes every couple of years, this is the right item and the right price.
customer_reviews.author: Lazlo Panaflex

customer_reviews.title: This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great remote (and I tried a few). 8 items, do not confuse this with the 7 item Sony as you loose some important features. Why buy it? It's easily programmed by device and yet can be modified by each key with other remotes. Holds very nicely in your hand too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Garbage for a Hisense TV.
customer_reviews.text: I tried every code for my Hisense TV and none worked to program this remote. I then tried the auto search feature and it seemed to work. Unfortunately, more than half the buttons do something different than what they're labeled. This remote is trash and I'm only giving it 2 stars because volume, channel, and input work as they're supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Outdated
customer_reviews.text: No backline hard to program and wont control Xfinity box. Old remote with outdated support Info. Dont buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Suave

customer_reviews.title: The Sony remote for our Sony tv required no Set-up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sony because the tv was a Sony. We couldn’t believe how easy it was to get started. We started using the remote without having to do anything! We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M

customer_reviews.title: Works great righ out of the box
customer_reviews.text: My original Sony TV (very old CRT model) remote was getting faulty, so I thought a Sony universal remote would be a good replacement. Yes, the remote just works great with the TV right out of the box. Then I tried to control the DVD player (Philips brand) by following the user guide and entering the brand code. Once the correct one was entered (some brands have multiple codes), it worked. I can even open the tray from the new remote which does not exist on the original one. Now I can simply use one remote to control two devices, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: One caveat, however: be sure to have new batteries on hand before you try to teach this remote from another remote. I tried using a set that was less than fresh, thinking they'd be good enough. Big mistake! The remote would not learn ANYTHING until I put in new batteries. After that, it was a piece of cake. Battery strength is so critical for this thing to work, you'd think Sony would include the batteries. Puzzling. So, after living with this remote for several days, I can report that it is a joy to use. It is big, but its shape and balance are so well executed that its size is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: aeroman223

customer_reviews.title: Good remote!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good universal remote. It has lots of options and was easy to program. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the input button doesn't work on my TV and so I have to use the TV's original remote for changing input. Also, it is not very intuitive with how it handles with a satellite menu. For me it had a small learning curve, with my old universal remote I did not. Otherwise good remote, works fine, and after a little fumbling you learn which buttons to press for the satellite and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: E E R

customer_reviews.title: Button issues
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the buttons stuck causing the command to be sent twice. Otherwise it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Loraine

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good remote. I bought it to replace the Sony ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good remote. I bought it to replace the Sony RM-VL710 that lasted nine years. This one has a similar build even though the programming logic is entirely different. I've manged to make it a true activity-based remote for eight different activities of my home entertainment system. The two major shortcomings are the inability to change the active device with a macro and a lack of back lighting. I give it 5 stars, though, because there's no other way to get an activity-based remote at this low of a price.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Trivilino

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic remote at a budget price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this remote for 18 months and it has outperformed both of the Logitech Harmony remotes I previously owned, a 700 and 650. Easy enough to program when the instructions are followed (and I had a few moments of frustration by not reading them carefully). Batteries last longer in the Sony and it runs a lot faster when executing macros than the Harmony remotes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Melodic_agony

customer_reviews.title: Best remote for the money; buttons may be repairable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote a couple years ago to control a Samsung TV, Yamaha soundbar, Apple TV, Sony DVD. Yes, new alkaline batteries are usually needed during programming. But for everyday use, i use rechargeables. Just recently, the +Volume button started going intermittent. I started shopping around for another remote, but did not find anything as versatile as the 620 for the money. Then i read Don Walker's review from 1/3/12, took mine apart, and found the same oily deposit under the Volume control buttons. After a quick clean-up, the remote works fine again (thanks, Don). Glad to be able to stay with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good easy to use universal remote
customer_reviews.text: Good easy to use universal remote! It worked for everything! I've bought old classic, old school power house receivers from a friend, the catch, no remotes and could not order a separate remote. This baby really covers it all! Would absolutely buy again if need be!
customer_reviews.author: Diablo53

customer_reviews.title: Universal Remote Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote in the hope I would be able to rid myself of a half-dozen different remotes I collected for various DVD players, televisions and receivers I'd been given or had purchased over the years. It never failed to perform. Aside from that it's an attractive piece of engineering, feels good in the hand and is light and comfortable. The keys are back-lit as well, which helps. It's a Sony, after all, and worth the slightly higher price than some others in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Will Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one the first one lasted me six years with virtually no problems. Set up is not as hard as some people say take your time and read the direction or use the learning mode. Once you set it up you will love it
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bailey

customer_reviews.title: great remote if you never used the "600"
customer_reviews.text: WE have two VL600s and when we bought 3rd TV, assumed that we would get another. But now they sent us this one. If you have never had a 600 or 610, then you might love this. Great remote for the buck. But it is not nearly as easy to program as is the earlier remotes. More buttons and more steps to assign each. Took twice as long to set up. But once it is set up (recommend using the learning function to do it) then it is a pretty slick remote which rivals those costing 3 times as much. Just dont lose the original remotes and keep the instructions handy. (which are pretty easy to read)
customer_reviews.author: Gary Gale

customer_reviews.title: Very nice with lots of options.
customer_reviews.text: Once you learn to program the remote, you will really appreciate it. I have two & no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: William R Malady

customer_reviews.title: Learning function is not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: If you teach keys the remote will say it has learned them but when you use them they do not work - not always, but you can’t depend on it.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D. Dornbusch

customer_reviews.title: A Great Inexpensive Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: While this doesn't have all the frills of some of the Logitech Harmony remotes, it can do almost everything they can. It can even do macros (It can turn on the TV, receiver and dvd player all with one button press). I have been able to take out every remote in my living room with this remote. If it doesn't have a code for your device, you can make it learn each button (I did this for my Roku). You are also able to set it up so when you change the volume it changes it on a receiver instead of the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Riehl

customer_reviews.title: No need to program
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Sony TV or Blu-ray player, there is no need to program this. We have both, and lost the remote to the blu-ray. We tried a cheaper version of a replacement, and it even said it would work a blu-ray, but it didn't really (it would only play blu-rays with the voice over that described the scene - very annoying). This one works perfectly and so nice because it replaced two remotes with one. Don't mess around with cheap imitations if you have Sony products.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: love this remote!
customer_reviews.text: this is my second one of these. the select/enter button on the first one pretty much stopped working after a little over two years. i really like this remote. i have a multi amp surround sound entertainment system, DVR box and BD player and i can control everything with this remote. i really like the learning and macro functions. and i get all of this for $20, can't beat it
customer_reviews.author: E.K.

customer_reviews.title: A little complicated
customer_reviews.text: This does provide support for many devices. The one thing that could use some improvement is in how it is programmed. I had an old universal remote that had a way to connect to a computer for programming. Something like that would make this remote easier to program. Right now, the key sequences needed to program can be confusing. It is easy to miss one step and then have to go back to redo all the steps after the programming attempt fails. Once programmed, it does work well.
customer_reviews.author: StephenH

customer_reviews.title: One remote to rule them all...
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this I made sure (through online research... I heart the internet) that it would function with the devices that I had planned for it - and no disappointment there. The buttons are all laid out logically, big enough so that I don't press 3 at a time, yet the remote isn't so large as to tip the coffee table over. It is also smart enough to know that even though I have the blu-ray player selected, I actually want the volume on the television to increase.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kutschke

customer_reviews.title: Murphy's law is still valid
customer_reviews.text: Very good features. Feels strong and durable. Suitable for replace every Sony RC, and, with a code number, lots of other RC brands. Also supposed to be able to learn and registering commands from any IR RC. Any ? Well, not any ... not the one I bought it for, a RC of an AZAmerica digital tuner. Murphy's law is still valid !
customer_reviews.author: Perez Andres

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Controls all my Sony devices and my other brands and is easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: mafana j.

customer_reviews.title: I love my new universal remote control
customer_reviews.text: I love my new universal remote control. It was easy to program and has replaced all of my individual remote control devices for my sony cd player and blu ray player, my lg tv, my Sherwood stereo receiver, my vcr, and my insignia digital converter. My old remotes are now packed away in a drawer because I was able to train the universal remote to perform all of their former tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Disenchanted Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This remote has a huge list of device codes that work flawlessly, but for the few devices not coded, the cloning function works very well...if you follow the instructions closely and pay attention to the necessary light signals. My only irritation? Instead of Up/Down buttons this has -/+. Example: If you are in the guide on channel 1067 and you press + you go to 1066 because + means "UP" the list, NOT adding 1 as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron B.

customer_reviews.title: CONTROLS but with VERY LIMITED functionality
customer_reviews.text: So programming it to my various devices has mostly worked. However, the ONLY option it allows to change on my SONY SOUNDBAR is volume, input & power. I CANNOT change the difference sound settings the original control for the soundbar allowed to (Movie, Music, etc). IF I had the original control, I could "teach" this remote these functions. The original broke, hence why I ordered this replacement. So this frustrating limitation prevents me from giving this product anything higher than 2 stars. If ANYBODY could help with this, I'd be grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Javish

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY a disc tray OPEN button!!
customer_reviews.text: I have looked all over for a remote that i can use for all my devices AND open the disc tray to my Blu ray player. I am happy this one worked out. It is decently easy to program like other remotes. I have not tried the learning function yet. I had to use the search function for my little 24 inch Westinghouse but it eventually worked, then you can ask it what # it found. Hope I can use it for more things.
customer_reviews.author: betterforeign

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality at a low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This remote completely operates all of my devices: LG tv, fios set top box, and Samsung home theatre system. All the funtionality of this equipment was included in the device codes that come with the remote except for the on-demand function of the STB which is was easily able to program using the learning functionality. I am not easily impressed by electronics but this product exceeded my expectations of it especially considering the low cost. I would strongly recommend this remote to anyone who is tired of replacing the remotes the cable company provides and is looking for an all-in-one solution.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great remote. After using this for a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. After using this for a few weeks, I ordered another one. I replaced a much more expensive harmony remote. Only issue I had was trying to program it to control a roku 3. Luckily the harmony remote I previously used was programmed to control the roku, so I was able to make this remote "learn" the harmony buttons
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect universal remote for ~$20 dollars
customer_reviews.text: I use this remote with our Vizio TV, Sony AVR, and Sony BD. The remote has great functionality, lots of buttons, and is capable of learning from other remotes. With this one remote we control everything we have. On a side note, it works much better than the Vizio remote that came with the TV. We never have to fiddle around pointing it just right like you have to do with the Vizio remote. This one just works all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: The remote works fine as a remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote works fine as a remote, but i can't get it to learn the functions of my older remotes. I do not think they are compatible. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ For being a new working remote with good ergonomics. ⭐️⭐️⭐️ For not being able tonwork in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: PqModean

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to program for my stereo, and works easily.
customer_reviews.text: I lost the remote to my Sony stereo. And even though I don't have the old remote, this one was pretty easy to program. Not able to use all parts of my stereo with it (yet), much nicer that I can now control my volume (the knob broke in my move), so I can once again have music. Does control am/fm radio portion, on/off and volume. Sometimes you have to try different names for your products though to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine (Josie)  Grounds

customer_reviews.title: Super duper remote
customer_reviews.text: First, if you read the manual & follow the steps carefully then there won't be any problem (in my experience). This remote currently replace my Panasonic TV & BD player's remotes , Onkyo receiver's remote, and I'm glad I pick this over model 320 since it has extra 4 System Control buttons, which I assigned those to switch input sources for my Onkyo. I love the Code Searching function. My Panasonic remote has too many codes in the list, so instead of going through all those codes in try & error fashion, Code Searching helps picking out the right code immediately. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for BD530's remote
customer_reviews.text: Lost the original remote and bought it , it is nice and easy to use... my SONY LCD TV, BLPlayer are default for use. Other, such Apple TV, Comcast DVR, etc... with Macro Function, I did not use yet. Anyway , for 2-3 weeks, I did not have any issues except SONY BP530 needs to use "DISPLAY" button but I could not find it out on RMVLZ620. Try to use more and discover, then update here ...
customer_reviews.author: T. AOKI

customer_reviews.title: Great programmable remote at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Second of this model and fourth Sony learning remote I have bought. Can't be beat for functionality and reasonable price if you need to control several components. Macro capability is extremely useful. Takes a little study to program, but nothing the average tech inclined user should have a problem with. Just read the fine manual provided with the piece or online,
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic remote!
customer_reviews.text: We're so happy and have just ordered two more. Last winter we bought three Sony Bravia tv's from Amazon and love them. This remote works perfectly with them and with our very annoying Time-Warner digital cable. The Time-Warner remote is awful, and we had to also use the television remote. Now we are free of that nonsense. Besides, the buttons on this remote are much better organized on it and are easier to see.
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Except, For My Amplifier, that is!?
customer_reviews.text: I am confident my new remote will handle everything I might need; but, I was stunned to find out it does not control an older Sony Active Sound System. Worse, sony.com has no helpful info - NONE. Yet, it works with an older cable tv, dvr combo; and, it works perfectly with my Sony tv and dvd recorders (both older). Try the URC WR-7 if you want complete control. Plus, it's a bit cheaper. My rating should read: three 1/2 stars. It's good, but could've been great.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It performs well. The only negative point is that in the learning mode procedure the instruction says the setup LED will be blinking but instead it stays on, by trial and error I finally figured out how to overcome it. So, I imagine if some users follow the instruction exactly the way it is written they may think that unit is not functioning properly.
customer_reviews.author: BCF

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty awesome remote for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty awesome remote for the price. If you are looking for a great feeling remote that you can set up with manufacturer codes, or teach the remote from another remote, and also have 4 buttons that you can setup macros for easily switching between sources - this a great remote. Very impressed for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Starbuck

product_meta.title: Sony RMVLZ620 Universal Remote Control (Black)
product_meta.description: The RM-VLZ620 provides centralized control of all of your Audio Video devices, saving the trouble of operating other A/V devices with different remote controls. To use with non-Sony A/V devices, or Sony devices that are not preset at the factory , you need to set the manufacturer’s code for each device to any of the eight Device Select buttons. You can centralize control of all of your Sony devices and can also control non-Sony devices. You can teach the RM-VLZ620 new functions and perform a consecutive procedure by simply pressing one button.
feature_bullets: Learning function for expanded AV equipment control
It controls up to 8 AV components
It has 12 one-touch system control functions (macros)
It controls TV, VCR, DVD on-screen menu
